alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Hoke; Moore (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 17 at 7:39PM EST until December 17 at 10:00PM EST by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Cumberland, Hoke and Moore counties in central North Carolina. * WHEN...Until 930 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring. Beaver Creek is rising rapidly due to an area of very heavy rainfall that just moved through. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 736 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fayetteville, Southern Pines, Raeford, Fort Liberty, Aberdeen, Pope AFB, Antioch, Hope Mills, Whispering Pines, Stedman, Vass, Cameron, Rockfish, Bonnie Doone, Silver City, Vander and Cedar Creek.
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Slow down and use caution to avoid hydroplaning. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
